Definition: Read the given news article and classify it into one of the four topics – 1. 'World' if it’s about the world. 2. 'Sports' if it talks mainly about sports. 3. 'Business' if it’s related to business. 4. 'Sci/Tech' if the content is relevant to science/technology.

Positive Examples.input: Paris Club agrees on Iraq debt reduction A French finance ministry spokesman said the Paris Club of creditor nations had reached a deal yesterday to write off 80 per cent of the debts Iraq owes them.
Positive Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article is about the world issues. Hence, the label is 'World'.

Positive Examples.input: Chiefs Stop Ravens 27-24 for First Victory In the NFL its best to keep a sleeping giant down but despite a stellar offensive performance by the Chiefs, the Baltimore Ravens were very opportunistic but in the end the Chiefs defense made the plays and Kansas City wins their first game of the season
Positive Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article talks mainly about sports. Hence, the label is 'Sports'.

Positive Examples.input: Wall Street Doubts Kmart Strategy Since emerging from bankruptcy in May 2003, the company has undergone a dramatic turnaround, seen an almost eight-fold increase in its stock price and now plans to buy department store operator Sears, Roebuck (S:NYSE - news - research) for about \$11
Positive Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article is related to business . Hence, the label is 'Business'.

Positive Examples.input: Yahoo! upgrades its e-mail Yahoo! announced Monday that it is upgrading some components of its e-mail service. The main change is the implementation of the company #39;s DomainKeys anti-spam technology (see our previous coverage).
Positive Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article has content that is relevant to science and technology. Hence, the label is 'Sci/Tech'.

Negative Examples.input: Gary Megson dismissed as manager of West Bromwich Albion on <b>...</b> Gary Megson was dismissed as West Bromwich Albion manager on Tuesday, just hours after saying he would quit at the end of the season, Britain #39;s Press Association reported.
Negative Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article is relevant to sports. The label that is provided ('Sci/Tech') is wrong and should instead be 'Sports'.

Negative Examples.input: Intel claims 65 nanometre breakthrough CHIP GIANT INTEL is expected to announce today that it has succeeded in producing an SRAM using 65 nanometre technology. The chip circuit gates are also a third smaller than using the current 90 nanometre process technology, Intel will claim.
Negative Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article is relavant to sciene and technology. The label that is provided ('Business') is wrong and should instead be 'Sci/Tech'.

Negative Examples.explanation: The topic of the news article is relevant to world issues. The label that is provided ('Business') is wrong and should instead be 'World'.
